site_name: 241 Kings Road,Kingston Upon Thames,KT2 5JH

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Change of use from retail (Use Class A1) part of premises to Residential use (Use Class C3) to provide living room/lounge to existing 3 bedroom dwelling. Erection of a bay window to front elevation.
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The property shall be used as self-contained residential units as shown in the hereby approved drawings under Class C3 (a) and no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class C3 or C4 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order, with or without modification). Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to exercise control of the type of use within the category in order to safeguard the amenities of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
Condition 19 (Construction Management Plan) - RBK Neighbourhood Engineer has reviewed the information submitted and is satisfied this can now be approved.

Application SiteThe site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.ProposalErection of single storey rear extension and raised patio.Consultation6 adjoining neighbouring properties have been notified and no representations have been received.AssessmentThe key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.DesignPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should enhance local context by delivering buildings and spaces that positively respond to local distinctiveness through their layout, orientation, scale, appearance and shape, with due regard to existing and emerging street hierarchy, building types, forms and proportions.Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance in the Council's Residential Design Guide SPD 2013 require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officer Comment: The proposed extension would be of an acceptable height and although would project slightly beyond the parameters of the SPD in terms of depth, would maintain the existing separation from the neighbouring property at No.2 The Glebe. Officers also note that permission (19/01774/PNH) has been granted to No.6 The Glebe for a single storey rear extension 5m (d) x 3.83m(h), and this is currently under construction. The proposed extension would be 4m (d) x 3.9m (h).The proposed development is therefore considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design, and that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Neighbouring AmenitiesPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should deliver appropriate outlook, privacy and amenity, and should help prevent or mitigate the impacts of noise and poor air quality.Policy DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy also seeks to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers. To this end, it states that developments should have regard to the amenities of occupants and neighbours, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  The proposed extension would be set behind the rear building line of the extension at No.6 The Glebe (currently under construction). There are some windows at No.2 The Glebe that currently have limited outlook given their side location. The extension would maintain the existing setback from the boundary and incorporate a pitched roof design to minimise the impact of any sense of enclosure.   Officers also acknowledge that an extension deeper than proposed would be possible under permitted development.Taking this into account, although the proposal may result in some loss of light to the window in the side elevation of No. 2, the level of outlook from this window is unlikely to be any worse as a result of the current development, than experienced through a similar or potentially larger proposal under permitted development. It is therefore considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.In conclusion, the proposed development is considered to be in accordance with the development plan taken as a whole and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than in accordance with the development plan.

Please confirm description of proposed works "Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with approved plans of Planning Permission 21/01032/PACND -Approved under Appeal Ref: APP/Z5630/W/21/3277999 (Erection of an additional 2 storeys to existing B1 Office to create 45 self-contained flats (19 no. two bedroom, 21 no. one-bedroom and 5 no. studios) with associated works and installation of Juliet balconies) to allow for the following changes: - Removal of curtain wall glazing and replacement with traditional brickwork and windows along East and North elevations.-The ridge height has increased by 225mm, but is still below the 7m threshold as allowed under permitted development rights."
Please provide a payment of £300 to accompany your application. This payment can be made online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Care Line on 020 8547 5022

Please note that the quality of advice will be proportionate to the level of information provided, therefore it is to the applicants benefit to provide as much supporting information as possible for the proposal. eg: plans and elevations, photographs and supporting documents.
